Welp, I can kind of recommend it, I mean, they really need to work on these goddamn hitboxes and I don't think that dedicated servers will really help that much as we expected.
I am trying this game again because of the future Stranger Things chapter. I loved the series and actually, the announcement of Stranger Things being added in DBD inclined me to watch Stranger Things.
My advice is that if you like the game, try to ignore the toxic behaviour, even though it haunts you, but as the time goes, you will become better and will play against high-skilled players that'll probably not be that toxic. That's how every game with ranking system works. You will meet some toxic people in the lower ranks 'cause that's just how things go.
So yeah, I do recommend this game if you can somewhat don't care about stupid opinions or if you just ignore toxic behaviour

I love this game, its one of the only "grind" games I play and I enjoy almost everything about it! Something that i think can be changed is when you do play with friends and after the match you play ends, it boots you out of the queue and you have to remake the party, thats a bit annoying and I believe can be fixed relatively easily.

**Edit** The first issue I had with this game back in 2019 has been fixed. I still enjoy this game when I have a full squad but the community is full of very unsportsmanlike people and it makes the game unbearable a lot of the time. I wish there was more of a penalty for people who play as survivor with other random players and choose to screw them over completely and ruining the game. I will say that although I hate the toxic killers out there, it's much more easy to deal with and still be able to get something from the game points wise than dealing with toxic survivors. I really do not advise getting the game unless you have friends who will play this with you if you wish to play survivor.

Dead by daylight ist ein wirklich süchtig machendes game wo du immer besser wirst je öfter du es spielst. Am Anfang dachte ich mir nich das ich es länger als fünf stunden spielen werde aber falsch gedacht. egal ob als Killer oder Überlebender du willst immer besser werden als deine letzte spielrunde, obwohl es am Anfang wirklich schwer ist zu verstehen wie man als Surviver oder killer spielt. wenn man aber dran bleibt und länger spielt bekommt man es immer besser in den griff entweder länger zu überleben oder mehr leute an den haken zu bekommen .  für mich eine klare kaufempfehlung

Honestly this game is amazing. Yes, it has its flaws but what game doesn’t. when you play as a killer you are unstoppable unless you get a survive with friends then they bully you XD. Even if this happens you gain knowledge for next time. They have a good selection of killers with their own perks and abilities. You will have fun playing a killer [ btw I am a killer main]. When you play survivor you also have a fun time. Hiding and mind F**king killers and don’t get me started with friends. You WILL EVEN HAVE A BETTER TIME!! This is a game you must try especially with friends! 20/10. Would play again in another life time. ^-^

The only real issue with this game is that the killers are way too sexy, it's hard to focus on your objectives as a survivor when all I see and hear are the claps of the killer's massive butt cheeks, other than that no problems. Especially no technical issues.

Just wanted to give my initial thoughts on this game. I picked it up because it was on sale and figured it would be worth it just to try, but I ended up liking it much more than I thought I would. I have really enjoyed playing it. A lot of people say the community is toxic, and while that can be true in some instances, I've only ever come across that maybe 3/10 games so far. 

My issues with the game are just a few things. The biggest problem so far is the progress reset bug. I spent several hours leveling up a character from level 1 to 11. The next day I booted up the game, and the character was reset back to 1. The only silver lining in this, is that because it's a known bug, you just create a support ticket and the devs make it right by crediting you back your Bloodpoints (in game leveling currency). Another issue I've come encountered is the lack of dedicated servers. You connect to one host, and if their ping is bad, you lag all over. Luckily, that should be changing, as the devs have dedicated servers on their roadmap for this year. The last issue I have is the amount of time it takes to actually get into a game when you are playing the Killer. I typically play Survivor only with friends, but when I am alone and have Daily Rituals for Killers, I'll jump in to try and complete those. It seems like it takes anywhere between 3 - 10 minutes at time to get into a game. 

Other than those issues, I really do recommend it. I picked it up on sale for $10 and it's been worth every penny in the amount of entertainment I've gotten from it. Some people will not be okay with the semi-toxic community, although, every community can be toxic, but I would say don't base your decision on that alone.

EDIT: Wanted to edit this now after playing this game A LOT. As far as my 3 issues are concerned:

- Haven't had the character reset bug again since right when I first got this game
- Dedicated servers are now in, but...
- It still takes awhile to get into games both on Survivor and Killer sides. 

The dedicated servers did make some things better for sure. But they are still working out kinks in the system. Getting hit after very clearly being on the other side of a window vault, killers lagging in one spot and then all of the sudden hitting you, survivors not being able to use specific perks. It's not a "mess" right now, but it's just got more work to be done. I still recommend the game however. Obviously, I have played quite a bit since the original posting of this review: 15.3 hours to 162.3 hours)

Game will have bugs but it's tolerable. Very fun with friends as well. Endless amounts of "builds" you can do with either survivor or killer too create a new experience with how you wanna play.

Edit:Now that the MMR system has been implemented I have no desire of returning back to this buggy game. The devs clearly don't care about their fanbase. They care about the profits only. They refuse to try to change things up as far as what perks are strong and what perks are weak, it's the same stuff at higher MMR for the most part. I bought this game back in March of 2017, sad to say how much it's changed... For the worst.
